Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: jkotrla
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, WiFi (if you pay for it) barely reaches into the rooms and is as sluggish as an antique 14.4kbps modem. Breakfast is coffee, cereal, and disgustingly sweet croissants served from 0730 to 0800 only. There is a 0100 curfew with no exceptions made for any reason. If you are not in the hotel by 0100, you are spending the night on the street. The owner was extremely rude to our group and left a horrible taste in our mouths of Roma hospitality. Although it is physically convenient to the main terminal, I would strongly suggest walking another block to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just save yourself the drama and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Wanderplus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through the services at the train station. What a mistake this was. From day one, we were treated like criminals and just inconvenienced in general for the duration of our stay. Unbearable and unnecessary. I've had great experiences in equivalent hotels in Rome. With so many choices in this city, you'll have better chances just about anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Overall poor quality and service”
Reviews.Author: KimbooDK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel on a class trip, and was very disappointed with it. The rooms are just like they look on the hotels website, which is totally acceptable. Unfortunatly, nothing in them works. The safe did not work in any of the rooms, the TV did not work in my room and most of the bathrooms had a terrible stinch. When we complained about the problems, we got no help at all. They just said "Thats how it is in all the rooms" - Great, thanks for nothing! Furthermore the beds very terrible and the noise from the street was excessive, so avoid this hotel if you're actually the type who sleeps. The pricing is low and the rooms had a descent size. Therefore i give it the rating "poor" but its close to "terrible".

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: W_J_V
Reviews.Content: Although Hotel Marisa has a good location, being next to Termini, for most rooms, that's where it ends. Very basic indeed. Very noisy as well, even at night. The beds are comfortable though. The TV only had Italian channels which was not too exciting. The guy who gave us our keys was a bit grumpy and the breakfast is quite awful. Best go somewhere else for that. The area it is in is full of beggars and homeless people, so you've got to watch out. Although in Rome you shouldn't idle in your room, it is very nice to get back to comfortable room after a long day of walking and sightseeing. This was not it. The elevator was usually broken so had to walk up about 3-4 flights of stairs before reaching the room. We did have a balcony, which was nice. All in all, only go here if you're on a budget and don't plan on spending too much time in your room. And all the other hotels are full.

Reviews.Title: “3 Bad nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: JColemanUK
Reviews.Content: What can I say. A 3 star hotel which should be 1 star. Room had ok beds but the sheets were riped. TV remote damaged. Bathroom toilet sheet cracked (Did get replaced) sink hanging off the wall. Very basic room. Breakfast was bad, juice was bad. AIR CON - Costs 20 euros and breakfast cost 10 euros We did not pay for the air con and left the windows open was so noisy Forget a good nights sleep. Hotel lift in bad repair.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Marisa
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marsala 98, 00185 Rome, Italy
